Author: Blue M'aiq#2538
Content: Has anybody tried to port komodo to any of the BSDs?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Blue M'aiq doubt it, radix42#3743 would likely be a good person to talk about it. I see she has BSD binaries for zcash on her site. She did the ARM port of komodod

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Blue M'aiq yes, FreeBSD mostly works. OpenBSD is missing some important dependencies like Rust. If you are a BSD lover, we would love some help. I would love to run Hush+KMD on openbsd.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: radix42 is the BSD whisperer

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: running on bsd would be cool.  i can fire up a bsd server.  i know some service providers prefer bsd.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: https://pastebin.com/VTFPTGsr

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: I had a RICK chain go on a fork.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: fixed it with invalidateblock/reconsiderblock

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: the helpful _please help human_ statement was not accurately reporting when the fork point was however.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo how was it wrong?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
current tip: 128602
fork point: 122908 <--- wrong   5694 blocks to here.

reconsider block: 122212  <---- actual fork point

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: the fork point detection.  maybe it found more forks points on the network?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: @dukeleto yeah sorry, i should have given a bit more razor sharp focus than leaving the clues dangling in the wind

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo yeah, maybe there were multiple forks. The code that prints the info in "help me human" could maybe be improved, too.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: yep.  no need to guess, just tell how to fix.  look up explorer.  i just guessed in 1k block intervals.  took about 15 guesses halving each time 游땎

Content: 32GB of DDR4 for $140! I remember paying $200 for 4MB of RAM, so I could play games in DOS

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 64GB seems to be the current max for DDR4 normal mobo's

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: was looking forward to 77GB, darn

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am building a new 3rd gen Ryzen desktop dev machine, for fun and to have a damn fast place to compile stuff

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it will also allow me to performance test shielded transactions on this new CPU, nobody has any stats

Content: 3rd gen stuff are making Threadripper prices come down, but they are still expensive

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c this fpga stuff claims a 200X improvement in Equihash block validation and 1.5X improvement in secp256k1 verification: https://www.zfnd.org/blog/fpga-acceleration-project/

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: interesting that secp256k1 verification isnt sped up very much. makes a signature based mining an intriguing possibility

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @qqil we make test chains in KMD world, not testnets. We have tools that make creating new chains trivial, so when you ask for a "testnet", we call that a "testchain" here. A testchain is better and more general than a testnet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: we also do have regtests and tests that can talk to a testnet/testchain

Author: qqil#7977
Content: idk how you name it, but in general, working with other coins, it is testnet. also in electrumx i can't see anything except Komodo network (no private chain network, etc.)

Content: @dukeleto
